result.title: SocialCar Testing and Integration
result.description: This deliverable consists of the integrated SocialCar solutions and services (including the SocialCar App). It includes the operational and tested end-user applications, along with the interconnected SocialCar back-end services. One part of the deliverable contains the documentation of the testing and validation strategies that were adopted in the project.

result.title: Social transport graph – Route planning and ride matching_1
result.description: This deliverable contains the data model for the SocialCar platform. It represents a multilayer temporal network for both public and private transport. It integrates the representation of car pooling services. It fit and position users in motion and users, characterizing their transport demand, and also including information about their reliability and trust in the use and provision of car pooling services. The deliverable also contains the algorithms to be used in the SocialCar platform. It describes the dynamic route planning, ride matching, tracking and destination tagging algorithms. It defines the algorithms to measure and update user reputation and the reward and incentive mechanisms. The deliverable is first released at month 9 and it is finalised at month 30.

result.title: Strategy road map for software integration
result.description: This deliverable consists of developing a strategy roadmap for the integration and enhancement of the software systems Adhocracy and Flashpoll. The two systems will be integrated as deeply as possible in order to enable project initiators in European administrations and organizations to configure web based (Adhocracy) as well as mobile (Flashpoll) online participation processes on the basis of combinable software components. The Strategy Road Map for software integration will define steps and intermediate objectives to set up a resource efficient software architecture, as well as provide a framework for the creation and design of up to 10 ready-use-software compontents which will be offered in the toolkit of EUth-systems. Issues of multilingual usage, privacy and data security will be a focal point of attention in the Road Map.

result.title: First release of EUth-systems
result.description:
The software components for EUth-systems will be developed over the course of the project in three iterative cycles with special focus on the feedback and requirements of the partner organizations and the users in the pilot projects. The software components will be finalized in three releases and offered to the partner organizations for testing.
Deliverable 2.2 encompasses the deployment of the first 2-3 compontents and APPS in the toolkit EUth-applications. The software applications are developed and designed according to the requirements identified in the design workshops during the first iterative cycle. The browser-based user interface for the applications is finalized and enables the testing of the applications on different devices, that is desktop computers, laptops or smartphones. The back-end and front-end components will be optimized in the course of the following 2 iterative cycles.

result.title: Memory of understanding EUth-toolkit
result.description: The EUth “Memory of understanding” will be the result of the EUth-toolkit European Design Workshop. It will be an agreement between the partners that will summarize the perimeter of Euth Toolkit. It will fix the Reach but also the limits of the Applications, Methods and Services (what we will be able to do, which are the limits of the development in the 3 years). It will serve as a base for the requirement list.

result.title: Exploitation plan I
result.description: An initial market analysis will be carried out in M1-M12 and an exploitation plan will be established started from the M12- M24 in order to have a written and agreed document across the whole consortium on exploitation strategies within the ENviSION consortium and individual actions. The exploitation plan will be developed into a practical roadmap with activities to be taken after the project in M25-36
